greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerators of the convergents of the continued fraction for sqrt(sqrt(2) - 1), the radius vector of the point of bisection of the arc of the unit lemniscate (x^2 + y^2)^2 = x^2 - y^2 in the first quadrant.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = -2..1000
mathematica: nmax = 100; cfrac = ContinuedFraction[ Sqrt[Sqrt[2] - 1], nmax + 1]; Join[ {0, 1}, Numerator[ Table[ FromContinuedFraction[ Take[cfrac, j] ], {j, 1, nmax + 1} ] ] ]
xref: Cf. A154747, A154748 and A154750 for the decimal expansion, the continued fraction and the denominators of the convergents.
results.author: _Stuart Clary_, Jan 14 2009
